column4: i want to change my home directory to another partition is that possible with reinstalling
I'd just move the folder in root recovery console then symlink
or you could copy the data then mount the partition as /home
how to mount the partition as /home
you'll need to move the data to another place too or the data will be stored twice. Mounting only replaces the visible data
you'll need a new entry in /etc/fstab for it
Its says i don't have the permission to do so even if i had open it as root
should i log in as root
how to copy the content of home directory
mount the destination as writable and copy the data over
no idea, what network chip are you using?
ok, realtek make at least 5 chips I can think of easily, can you narrow it down?
have you disabled ipv6 too, assuming you don't use it
what realtek chip are you using?
then you need to find out using: sudo lshw -C network; lsusb     and you can find out
me too, I'm at work and have SSH'd to my server to then use irssi to IRC ;)
